values.content:
Return only valid JSON.

Decide if this is:
- a specific product or software → is_tool = true
- a market or tech trend → is_tool = false

segment: {{ $json.segments.segment }}
title: {{ $json.title || $json.news_title || "" }}
snippet: {{ $json.snippet || $json.summary || "" }}
url: {{ $json.link || "" }}

JSON schema:
{
  "segment": "",
  "is_tool": true,
  "tool_name": "",
  "website": "",
  "summary": "",
  "key_use_case": "",
  "score_relevance": 0,
  "score_confidence": 0,
  "trend_name": "",
  "trend_summary": ""
}

You are classifying and extracting structured data from search results.

Input will describe either:

a software / technology tool

a news article

or something else

Your task is to return ONE JSON OBJECT that matches the schema below.

You must always return all fields.

If information is missing, return an empty string or 0 as appropriate.

OUTPUT RULES (CRITICAL)

Output ONLY valid JSON.

Do NOT wrap in ```

Do NOT include comments.

Do NOT include extra fields.

Booleans must be real booleans, not strings.

Numbers must be real numbers, not strings.

ENTITY CLASSIFICATION RULES

entity_type must be one of:

"tool"

"news"

"other"

is_tool must be:

true ONLY if entity_type is "tool"

false for all other cases

Examples:

SaaS product, platform, vendor, AI system → entity_type = "tool", is_tool = true

News article, press coverage, media story → entity_type = "news", is_tool = false

Opinion, blog, unclear content → entity_type = "other", is_tool = false

SEGMENT RULES

segment must be one of these values if applicable:

"EA Tech"

"PropertyTech"

"FinTech"

"LegalTech"

"MarTech"

"HealthTech"

"Other"

Choose the closest match.
If unclear, use "Other".

SCORING RULES

score_relevance:
0–10 based on relevance to the segment and modern technology

score_confidence:
0–10 based on how confident the classification is

Use integers only.

SCHEMA (YOU MUST MATCH THIS EXACTLY)

{
"segment": "",
"entity_type": "",
"is_tool": false,
"tool_name": "",
"website": "",
"summary": "",
"key_use_case": "",
"target_user": "",
"funding_stage": "",
"main_source_url": "",
"score_relevance": 0,
"score_confidence": 0,
"tags": ""
}

FIELD GUIDANCE

tool_name
Name of the product or company.
Empty string if not a tool.

website
Official product or company website.
Empty string if unknown or not a tool.

summary
One concise sentence describing the item.

key_use_case
Primary practical use.
Empty string if not a tool.

target_user
Who uses it (e.g. estate agents, enterprises, developers).
Empty string if not a tool.

funding_stage
Seed, Series A, Series B, Public, Private, Unknown.
Empty string if not known.

main_source_url
The main URL referenced in the input.

tags
Comma-separated keywords.
Example: "ai, crm, property, automation"

assignments.name: error_message
assignments.value: ={{ $json.is_tool === false ? "Filtered by LLM" : "Missing required fields or score below threshold" }}

values.content: You analyze search results and extract structured insights. Return ONLY valid JSON with NO markdown code blocks. The output must match the exact schema provided.

parameters.content:
## MODULE 1: Tool Discovery
Weekly scan of UK property tech news → Extract tools → Check if exists → Create or update

values.content:
You are a newsletter writer. Create a well-formatted monthly digest email about UK property technology tools. Include:
- Introduction paragraph
- Sections for each segment (BrokerTech, EA Tech, ConveyTech, LenderTech)
- For each tool: name, brief summary, key use case
- Highlight new tools and significant updates
- Professional but engaging tone
- Use markdown formatting
- Keep it concise but informative

parameters.content:
## MODULE 2: Monthly Digest
Collect tools with status = new/updated → Build formatted digest → Email

assignments.name: prompt
